verses.roman:
govardhana dekhi' prabhu ha-ilā daṇḍavat
'eka śilā' āliṅgiyā ha-ilā unmatta

synonyms: govardhana dekhi'-seeing Govardhana Hill; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; ha-ilā daṇḍavat—offered obeisances like a straight rod; eka śilā—one piece of stone; āliṅgiyā—embracing; ha-ilā—became; unmatta—maddened.
translation: When the Lord saw Govardhana Hill, He immediately offered obeisances, falling down on the ground like a rod. He embraced one piece of rock from Govardhana Hill and became mad.
